page.title: 02Ingleston Farm
page.content: Ingleston Farm is a beef and sheep farm mainly, but they also grow crops like silage, barley, hay and grass. They have got blue-grey Hereford and Charolais cows. The owners of the farm have a lot of machinery and some of it is contracted out in certain seasons. Most of the trees on the farm are deciduous, and have been grown as shelter-belts. There are six people living on the farm. They employ one worker. He lives in a cottage at the bottom of the road. The two children who live on the farm do take an interest in the farm by helping with chores. The original farmhouse was built about 1700. Nowadays, visitors, mostly old aged pensioners and young families visit the house as bed and breakfast facilities are available.
